item.description:
This is a roughly 5 mile hike with water views in Mansfield Hollow State Park around the northern end of Mansfield Hollow Lake. We will follow the blue blazed trail that circles the lake. There are two spots of only about .1 mile each where we will have to walk on the shoulder of a road but this should not be an issue.

We will meet at the park at 10 AM at the northwestern parking area off of Rte. 89. Then we will hike in a clockwise direction around the lake. The hike should last about 2.75 hrs. at a leasurly pace and be over by about 12:45 PM.

The group has the option of stopping someplace in Mansfield Center or Storrs for lunch.

The leader on this one is Kevin S (http://hiking.meetup....) so please direct questions on this event to him.

Pets on a leash are permitted in picnic areas and on hiking trails. No swimming is allowed since the lake is used for public water supply. Boating is allowed though.

Directions:
From Hartford:
* Take Route 84 east, Exit 68.
* Follow Route 195 south until intersection with Route 89. (You will cross Route 44, go through the UCONN campus to the junction of Route 89.)
* Take a left on Route 89.
* Parking area is on your right roughly .75 mile.

From Willimantic:
* Route 195 north to Route 89.
* Take a right onto Route 89.
* Parking area is on your right roughly .75 mile.

A map can be found at:
http://www.dep.state....

For more information, see http://www.dep.state....

item.name: Hike at Mansfield Hollow SP in Mansfield CT
